author: Surixurient

text:
@YinYang19 
Take my advice.. Avoid Alundra 2 like the damn and bloody pox that it is.
The gameplay wasn't up to snuff,
The story couldn't keep it rolling (predictably dull)
Even the music couldn't match up to its predecessor.

I can't believe I even sat through days of trying to beat it *eyetwitch*

Alundra all the way baby.

author: Sinspiration

text: @Sinspiration Well I'm just saying that kind of thing does happen, but I understand at least there are similar characters and/or reference points/constants with the other franchises (even if that constant is everything being different like FF). As I mentioned companies are sometimes dirty dogs who go Q:"how can we make money off a piece of shit??" A:"....We'll sell that piece of shit with a label that reads 'GOLD' so ppl will buy it". It was indeed blunt and they didnt think it out too well.
author: J.M
Sinspiration

text: @Sinspiration Agreed. But they obviously partly did that for Alundra 2 to be recognised and to sell more copies. Companies do this all the time. Alot of people debate about whether the recent final fantasies, castlevanias and zelda games are true to their previous iterations... This goes all the way back to NES Zelda II syndrome
author: J.M

text: it would be impossible for me to rate my top 5 games of all time, because franchises often come out with new games which I like more or less than their predecessors... But Alundra on its own is the gem will always take one of those spots, now that my friends is a Real Game.... Alundra>Zelda ALTTP

author: Vangros Ethemoc

text:
I might love Zelda, but Alundra is obviously much much better. It is reaally immersing, with an incredible story, and a huge array of characters, each with their own personality that will make you either love them or hate them with a passion.

For those who haven't played Alundra, but like adventure/rpg games, I recommend this game. The puzzles will make you want to punch puppy fetuses, but I can't think of a game that's better than this.

text:
One of my favorite tracks from the game.  Was always curious to see what'd be like if the "outside" tracks of Alundra and Final Fantasy VII had switched places, or even Ocarina of Time's.  This one seems to provide a unique medium between those two.

Great great add, SupraDarky.
